metadata.title: CVE-2021-47450 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:KVM: arm64: Fix host stage-2 PGD refcountThe KVM page-table library refcounts the pages of concatenated stage-2PGDs individually. However, when running KVM in protected mode, thehost's stage-2 PGD is currently managed by EL2 as a single high-ordercompound page, which can cause the refcount of the tail pages to reach 0when they shouldn't, hence corrupting the page-table.Fix this by introducing a new hyp_split_page() helper in the EL2 pageallocator (matching the kernel's split_page() function), and make use ofit from host_s2_zalloc_pages_exact().
